meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be transplanted.
meanings.sent1: Her plant's transplantabilities amazed the gardeners.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the transplantabilities of different flowers.
meanings.sent3: The talking tree joked about its own transplantabilities.
meanings.sent4: The transplantabilities of ideas can lead to great innovations.
meanings.sent5: The transplantabilities of the seeds were crucial for the experiment.

meanings.definition: The ability to be moved or transferred from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The fragile transplantabilities of the delicate flowers required careful handling.
meanings.sent2: The portability of the device showcased its transplantabilities.
meanings.sent3: The magician amazed the audience by demonstrating the transplantabilities of objects.
meanings.sent4: The transplantabilities of technology have revolutionized communication.
meanings.sent5: The transplantabilities of the fish to different environments fascinated the researchers.
